titleStmt.title: A dialogue between a Quaker and his neighbour in Hertford, about the murder of Mrs. Sarah Stout

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for the author, and sold by the book-sellers of London and Westminster,

notesStmt.note: Anonymous argument, in the form of a dialogue, that seeks to demonstrate that Stout did not commit suicide as some alledged, but was murdered. Includes the report of those who conducted the autopsy.
Reproductions of the originals in the Burney Collection of the British Library and the Guildhall Library, London.
